content: Niobrara River & Missouri River west of Gavins Point Dam near the South Dakota, Nebraska border. (American Rivers: The river Niobrara drains one of the most arid sections of the Great Plains and has low flow for a river of its length. Its name comes from the Ponca saying, Ni Ubthatha khe, meaning “water spread-out horizontal-the”) This land marks the location of the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe challenge to the Keystone oil pipeline beginning in 2017__no.0061, 2016. #SouthDakota #StandingRock
